Issues.Title: [Accessibility] HC themes: The color contrast is less than 4.5:1 for the text "Document does not contain any pages" in printPreviewControl
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 10.0.100-alpha.1.24556.12

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, also repro in previous versions

### Issue description

The color contrast is less than 4.5:1 for the text "Document does not contain any pages" in printPreviewControl 

**Win11 Results:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e2ddad7f-f191-4de2-82b5-5180efef4777)

**Win10 results:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0fc5bafd-bfa7-427f-96f5-f613c38b22aa)

**Framework results:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a9711c10-3858-4082-a7b8-ecc75bea6364)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Use attached application:
[RepoApplication.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17655376/RepoApplication.zip)
2. Set windows to different HC themes
3. build and run application
4. Obserrve the text "Document does not contain any pages" in printPreviewControl by using Accessibility Insight tools.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] HC themes: The color contrast is less than 4.5:1 for the text "Document does not contain any pages" in printPreviewControl" (#12441)

Issues.Title: When using up/down to toggle property value on edit text box, edit text box loses focus
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

10.0.100-alpha.1.24553.6

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, all versions have this issue

### Issue description

The rectangle always back to focus on entire row after using the up/down changed the `AutoSize ` property values directly in the edit textbox

![BeforeChanges](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8452b4d2-c08a-4f06-b0b6-4418f5a8a75a)

**Expected result:**
The rectangle in the edit text box always stays in the edit textbox when changing the property value using the up/down buttons 
![AfterChanges](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9e53bbd5-6c55-4eb5-bc31-2392c910417e)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Windows Forms App
2. Add a Button to form and focus on it
3. Open the property page
4. Open Inspect
5. Select `AutoSize` property
6. Changing the property value using the up/down buttons in the edit textbox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When using up/down to toggle property value on edit text box, edit text box loses focus" (#12440)

Issues.Title: Follow-up on 'Constructor on type 'System.Drawing.Image' not found' crash in .NET Core – Provided Sample Not Runnable
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2022 (64-bit) - Preview
Version 17.12.0 Preview 5.0

### .NET version

NET 9.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No

### Issue description

In a .NET Core project, when attempting to add an item as an image in the ImageCollection Editor via the Properties window, this error is encountered. This issue does not occur in the .NET Framework project.

Previous Forum Thread: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/10549

Current Situation: In response to our initial query, a sample was provided to help resolve the issue. However, the sample is not in a runnable state; it produces additional errors when we attempt to execute it. Screenshots of these errors are attached to this post for your reference.

Request for Assistance: Could someone from the support team review the sample provided in the original query and, if possible, provide an updated, runnable version? Alternatively, any guidance on resolving this issue within the .NET Core project would be greatly appreciated.![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/207fa248-eb9c-41a7-a847-89dcbbb70bb4)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0a2cad79-13a3-44fe-9371-9a1afe8b6db6)


### Steps to reproduce

1.Download the sample provided in the previous thread.
2.Open the solution in Visual Studio.
3.Attempt to build or run the project.

Observed Behavior: Errors appear in the Solution Explorer related to the NuGet package references, preventing the solution from building or running. Unfortunately, we’re unsure how to resolve these reference issues, as all necessary NuGets are already referenced in the sample.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Follow-up on 'Constructor on type 'System.Drawing.Image' not found' crash in .NET Core – Provided Sample Not Runnable" (#12435)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Pressing Up/Down keyboard in drop-down list of property collapses drop-down directly
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

10.0.100-alpha.1.24553.6

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, all versions have this issue

### Issue description

Pressing Up/Down keyboard in drop-down list of property collapses dropdown directly.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2d68ad2b-a52a-4348-ac19-ab94a99e1597)


**Expand Result**: Drop-down list keeps expanding state when pressing Up/Down keyboard, then pressing Enter can collapse it


### Steps to reproduce

Repro steps:
1.	Find one property with dropdown list in PropertyGrid, for example: **Multiline**
2.	Tab to its value part: **False**, then press Up keyboard  to change value: **True** --- it is necessary step
3.	Press Alt+Down or F4 to expand this property's drop-down list
4.	Press Down keyboard to choose another value: **False**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Pressing Up/Down keyboard in drop-down list of property collapses drop-down directly" (#12434)

Issues.Title: [release/9.0] fix #12365 [Accessibility] The text "Document does not contain any pages" in printPreviewControl has low color contrast
Issues.Body:
Backport of #12368 to release/9.0
BUG: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/12365
/cc @Epica3055

## 1.bug description
[Accessibility] The text "Document does not contain any pages" in PrintPreviewControl has low color contrast ratio, making it hard to read. Text to background ratio is 2.3:1 instead of the required 4.5:1 (https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/contrast-minimum.html)
## 2. customer impact
Accessibility requirement violation.
## 3. regression?
no
## 4. testing done
manual, using Accessibility insights
## 5. risk
low, these colors are not under user control.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[release/9.0] fix #12365 [Accessibility] The text "Document does not contain any pages" in printPreviewControl has low color contrast" (#12428)

Issues.Title: [Accessiblity] Narrator cannot announced the items correctly when switching the items by using up/down keyboard arrow that without expand the dropdown list panel
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 10.0.100-alpha.1.24553.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this issue cannot repro in .NET 3.1, can repro in .NET 5.0.

.NET 3.1:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3cd87bea-659a-445b-b475-8468be30fe5b)


### Issue description

When switching the items by using up/down keyboard arrow that without expand the dropdown list panel, Narrator announced the FlatStyle/BoserStyle property item twice, the first time unread in its entirety.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c860186-92be-4cac-a191-6959995cedbd)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d30d1426-f17c-4922-81fc-3cd33c0f14f9

**Expected behavior:**
Compare with NVDA tool, Narrator should be read the FlatStyle/BoserStyle property item only once and in its entirety.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3f29b2b9-88c0-4a73-9268-48dde318729e)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6627cef4-ac48-4c10-a48b-8d1b938d0d2b



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a .NET Core Winforms project.
2. Add a Label and PropertyGrid controls in form designer. 
3. Set the SelectedObject property to Label1 in propertyGrid1 control. 
4. Build and run project.
5. Open Narrator tool and select FlatStyle/BoserStyle property in propertyGrid control.
6. Use keyboard up and down key to select property item.

**More info:**
1. The issue cannot reproduce on standard combobox control.
2. The issue also can reproduce with other properties.
3. This issue cannot repro in NVDA tool.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessiblity] Narrator cannot announced the items correctly when switching the items by using up/down keyboard arrow that without expand the dropdown list panel" (#12421)
